Description:
Immaculate Inside and Out!
As meticulously presented today as the day it was built, this stunning townhouse in a group of only 3 is perfect for a range of buyers from first home buyers looking to enter the market at an affordable price to downsizers searching for a low maintenance townhouse in a quiet location or investors who want a great return (app. $320 per week) on a property that requires nothing more to do other than find tenants to move into it!
From the point of entry and right throughout this home exudes space, style and comfort with 2 spacious bedrooms, open plan living dining and kitchen area, beautifully appointed central bathroom, separate laundry and a private, north facing undercover outdoor entertainment area that is ready for use all year round from lazy Sunday morning al fresco breakfasts to summer BBQs with family and friends.
Outstanding features include higher than average ceilings that only amplify the feeling of space, quality tiling and carpet right throughout, full en-suite and walk-in robe in the master bedroom along with a large built-in robe in bedroom 2, central heating and reverse cycle heating and cooling unit in living and dining area, double blinds for extra privacy and a fully equipped chefs delight kitchen with plenty of bench and storage space, pantry, electric oven and gas cook top and space for a dishwasher.
Theres direct internal access to the home from the single lock-up garage with remote control and for those that require public transport theres a bus stop located only a short stroll away that will take you into Geelong or to the Newcomb or Belmont shopping centres and for those that commute to Melbourne the South Geelong train station is also close by.
A townhouse as well maintained as this is almost impossible to find and with Geelong becoming the place to be theres no doubt that it wont be on the market for long. Take the time to view and plan your future here!

Description:
The Ultimate Dream Starter
An inspiring surprise package awaits those who step in to this beautiful brick home set on approximately 603m2 and is perfect for the first home buyer or investor looking to secure a spot in this popular growth pocket of Geelong.

Other features of this unexpectedly spacious interior offers two bedrooms, both with ample built in robes, a modern family bathroom with double shower space and separate toilet.
The rear of the home provides access to the undercover entertainment area and deck that will make you the envy of family and friends with its intelligent design and views over the luscious rear yard. The long driveway allows easy access to the lock up garage at the rear of the block with an extra garden shed.
The location is excellent, only minutes from Geelong city, public transport, the iconic Geelong Football Stadium, Bellarine Rail Trail and Schools just around the corner, also the South Geelong train station is only a short walk providing an easy lifestyle for the Melbourne commuter.

Description:
History & charm
This charming double fronted Victorian provides a beautiful blend of the old and the new. Full of character, the house was built on the Ballarat goldfields around 1856 and moved to Geelong in two pieces in 1910. The home boasts five bedrooms with the generously sized upstairs main bedroom (WIR & double basin ensuite with full size, free standing bath), the balcony enjoys a beautiful leafy outlook. The other four bedrooms are downstairs, one of which is external, and a beautifully updated bathroom with spa bath is also located on the ground floor. The kitchen has a Smeg dishwasher, 700mm Smeg gas cooktop and double under bench multifunction electric ovens. A large laundry doubles as a butler's pantry with ample storage space. The entire house is warmed with a highly efficient, low emissions Lopi wood burner and cooled by two reverse cycle air conditioning units and ceiling fans. Exterior details include blue stone fishponds, extensive brick paving and a quiet, secluded rear yard.
The driveway is very wide and can easily accommodate two cars side by side, boat, caravan and trailer with easy access via a large sliding gate. With easy walking distance to the Garden Street Shops and the Eastern Gardens, easy access to the CBD and the Bellarine Peninsula, schools and public transport.

Description:
A real gem in East!
This lovely 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom home with 2 living zones and SLUG has everything you need and more. Sitting on a generous 563m2 this beautifully presented classic Californian Bungalow is tucked away in a peaceful pocket in the heart of East Geelong. With loads of street appeal and ideally located near East Geelong Village it would suit a professional couple or family looking to lay roots in this wonderful part of Geelong. Typical of the era it has a wide central hall with 12 foot ceilings, decorative cornice and Baltic pine flooring through the front portion of the home. The layout has the main bedroom to the right as you enter. To the left is the 2nd living/ 4th bedroom with a stunning Art Nouveau fire place and decorative mantle and stained glass bay window. Moving beyond this is the 2nd bedroom to the left and 3rd bedroom to the right. The bathroom with shower and bath is located between the bedrooms and the rest of the home. An extension to the rear of the home now provides a beautiful light filled space open plan kitchen, dining and living with the dining occupying a bay window looking out on the rear garden. The kitchen features gas cooktop and electric wall oven cream coloured cabinetry that compliments the rest of the home. A large laundry leads off from the kitchen and offers plenty of cupboard space. Climate control is provided via central under floor heating and split system airconditioning. A rear veranda and leafy garden all round really act to finish off what really is a gorgeous property. Rear access to a single lock up garage provide convenience and security for the owners. This really is a gem and well worth a closer look!
